item.title: Removeing all party hats!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Oh, Zyle reminded me that a major downside to this method of getting rid of rares is that the players need to be online.
I made a program to read from all the character files and delete any items listed in an array.
Here it is:

import java.io.*;

public class DeleteRares
{
	public static void main(String args[])
	{
		/**
		 * Put the item ids in this array.
		 * Don't put notes, though. It will cause problems.
		 */
		int[] rares = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048, 1050};
		File charFolder;
		BufferedWriter bw;
		BufferedReader br;
		BufferedWriter tmpwr;
		BufferedReader tmpr;
		boolean overwrite = false;
		String read;
		String dir = "characters/";
		double done = 0;
		int percent = 0;
		int percentRounded = 0;

		charFolder = new File(dir);

		if(!charFolder.exists())
		{
			System.out.println("The directory "+dir+" was not found.");
			return;
		}
		else
		if(charFolder.list().length == 0)
		{
			System.out.println("The specified directory is empty.");
			return;
		}
		String file[] = charFolder.list();
		for(String s : file)
		{
			try
			{
				boolean isAdmin = false;
				File charFile = new File(dir+s);
				File tmpFile = new File(dir+s+".tmp");
				tmpFile.createNewFile();
				br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(charFile));
				tmpwr = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(tmpFile, true));

				while((read = br.readLine()) != null)
				{
					if(read.contains("character-rights"))
					{
						if(read.charAt(read.length() - 1) > '1')
						{
							System.out.println("Bank saved for admin "+s.substring(0, s.indexOf(".")));
							isAdmin = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[ITEMS]") || read.equals("[EQUIPMENT]"))
					{
						if(!isAdmin)
						{
							overwrite = true;
						}
					}

					if(read.equals("[FRIENDS]") || read.equals("[LOOK]"))
						overwrite = false;

					if(!overwrite)
					{
						tmpwr.write(read);
						tmpwr.newLine();
					}
					else if(!isAdmin)
					{
						boolean found = false;
						for(int i : rares)
						{
							if(read.contains("\t" + i + "\t") || read.contains("\t" + (i + 1) + "\t"))
							{
								found = true;
							}
						}
						if(!found)
						{
							tmpwr.write(read);
							tmpwr.newLine();
						}
					}
				}
				tmpwr.flush();
				tmpwr.close();
				br.close();

				charFile.delete();

				bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(charFile, true));
				tmpr = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(tmpFile));

				while((read = tmpr.readLine()) != null)
				{
					bw.write(read);
					bw.newLine();
				}

				bw.flush();
				bw.close();
				tmpr.close();
				tmpFile.delete();

				done++;

				if((percent = (int)(done / file.length * 100)) % 5 < 5 && percent - percent % 5 != percentRounded)
					System.out.println((percentRounded = (int)(percent - percent % 5))+"%");
			}
			catch(IOException Ioe)
			{
				Ioe.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
		System.out.println("Finished!");
	}
}

Oh, and if you’re curious, the reason you can’t put noted ids in the array is that it already deletes notes automatically.

item.title: Removeing all party hats!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ya, bad coding technique on my part. And if i recall, there is a phat array already in one of the Item.java’s. The equipped, and banks wont be checked but that wont be hard as qwerty said, but this will only check online players. To completely get rid of all phats, you would have to make a FileReader, read each line, check and see if the line contains a Party Hat ID, if it does, Line.replaceAll(PHat, “0”);

Read full topic

item.title: Removeing all party hats!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

tau1928:

what? are you sure and that would go in client.java?

Technically since the phatIDs array is only being accessed from within the clearPHats method, it should be declared as a member variable of that method. Methods can be declared anywhere except from within other methods.
Call the method when the command is used. Also, note that this will only delete items in a player’s inventory. It won’t delete partyhats they have equipped or stored in their bank. That shouldn’t be too hard to do, though.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

yes, it should work, and it goes into client.java, but for your convenience, make aa command that calls clearPHats() when the command is used.

item.title: Removeing all party hats!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

maybe something along the lines of:

int[] phatIDs = new int[]
    {
        1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048
    };

public void clearPHats()
    {
        for(Player P : server.players) {//Or whatever the Player[] is called
        for(int PHat : phatIDs)
            {
                for(int Index = 0; Index < p.playerItems.length; Index++)
                    {
                        if(p.playerItems[Index] == PHat)
                            {
                                p.deleteItem(PHat, 1);
                            }
                    }
            }
            }
    }

or something along those lines
